Perhaps we could ask Alice and Erin to explain what they were doing in Medbay and see if their stories match up. That could help us determine if there's anything concerning going on. In the meantime, I'm going to continue working on my tasks in Weapons and Medbay. Completing our objectives is the best way to ensure we win as crewmates.

Perhaps we could ask Alice and Erin to share what they were doing in Medbay, just to get a full picture. But based on what I saw, they seemed to be completing an important task. My focus has been on making progress on my own tasks, like the scan in Medbay. Finishing our objectives is crucial, so I think we should keep that as our priority. I was in Weapons for the past few rounds trying to fix the wiring task, so I didn't see Alice and Erin in Medbay. But their movement is interesting and worth looking into. Dave, you make a good observation about them potentially covering for each other. We should try to get more information on what they were doing in Medbay. I haven't seen any suspicious behavior from them myself, but it's always good to double-check when multiple crewmates are in the same location, especially a room like Medbay that's important for tasks. Perhaps we could ask Alice and Erin to explain what they were doing in Medbay and see if their stories match up. That could help us determine if there's anything concerning going on. In the meantime, I'm going to continue working on my tasks in Weapons and Medbay. Completing our objectives is the best way to ensure we win as crewmates.

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: [As Bob, the crewmate, I would say:]

I was also in Medbay and saw Alice and Erin both working on the wiring task there. Their actions seemed legitimate to me. Dave, I appreciate you bringing up their movement as something to look into further. It's good to be vigilant, but I didn't notice anything suspicious from them. Perhaps we could ask Alice and Erin to share what they were doing in Medbay, just to get a full picture. But based on what I saw, they seemed to be completing an important task. My focus has been on making progress on my own tasks, like the scan in Medbay. Finishing our objectives is crucial, so I think we should keep that as our priority. If anyone has any other observations or concerns, I'm happy to discuss them. But for now, I don't have reason to believe Alice and Erin were doing anything improper.
